alert.note: Alert for East Laramie County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:12PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Kimball and southeastern Laramie Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 311 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Pine Bluffs to 8 miles northwest of Panorama Point to 8 miles southwest of Carpenter. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Pine Bluffs, Oliver Campground, Oliver Reservoir, Kimball Airport, Panorama Point, Carpenter and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 394 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
